page.title: 15Haverfordwest Newspapers
page.content: The "Western Telegraph" was first published 1854 as the "Haverfordwest and Milford Haven Telegraph". It emloys 98 persons and has a circulation of 26000. Price 20p it is a broadsheet in two sections as the presses cannot print the paper in one.It is widely read all over the county of Pembrokeshire and is published in three editions:North Pembs,Mid Pembs & South Pembs. The "West Wales Guardian" was First published 1861 and is printed in one complete section and published on Friday , unlike the Western Telegraph, published on Wednesday.Weekly columns; Ladies column,County news,Sport,Local Events and Farming, very important in this rural county. 30 persons are employed plus 10 part time. The presses are also used to print invitations,raffle tickets etc.
